creator: like268@gmail.com
text:
If the proxy_html module is included in the configure step with --enable-proxy-html then the LoadModule line is not created inside the httpd.conf file the same way that other modules are automatically included but commented out in httpd.conf.

eg, this is missing from httpd.conf:
#LoadModule proxy_html_module modules/mod_proxy_html.so

I can't reproduce that.

Note that a make install won't overwrite an existing httpd.conf. So if you enabled  proxy_html only on a second compile, maybe you were looking at your first (outdated) httpd.conf?
creator: sf@sfritsch.de

text:
Hi Peter,

this bug hasn't been updated for the past three yrs and Stefan didn't manage to repro the issue. At this point I am inclined to close the bug but please re-open it if you need  further assistance!

Luca
creator: toscano.luca@gmail.com
